title: How to Make Lavender Cupcakes

steps.headline: Put the milk and dried lavender flowers into a jug.
steps.description: Cover and refrigerate overnight. This will form part of the cupcake mixture. Do the same with the icing sugar (frosting), milk and lavender, only in a separate jug. This will form part of the icing (frosting) mixture.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to Gas Mark 3, 325ºF or 162ºC.
Mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder and butter.
steps.description: Combine well until the mixture becomes smooth and all ingredients are smooth.

steps.headline: Strain the lavender infused milk (for the cupcake) and throw away the flower buds.
steps.description: Pour into the flour mixture along with the egg and beat until well combined.

steps.headline: Spoon the mixture evenly into the paper cases (cupcake liners) until each case is two-thirds full.
steps.description: Place into the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes roughly. They are ready when a knife inserted in the centre of a cupcake comes out clean. Allow to cool on a wire cooling tack after removing from the oven using oven mitts.

steps.headline: Beat together the icing sugar and butter until there are no lumps.
steps.description: You can add a few drops of purple food colouring into the frosting mixture to make it seem more like lavender.

steps.headline: Strain the lavender infused milk, throw away the leaves and add this to the icing mixture.
steps.description: Beat until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Spoon the icing (frosting) on top of the cupcakes when cooled.
steps.description: Leave to set before serving. For a nice finishing touch, add a sprig of dried lavender on top of the lavender cakes.

text: Steps Put the milk and dried lavender flowers into a jug. Cover and refrigerate overnight. This will form part of the cupcake mixture. Do the same with the icing sugar (frosting), milk and lavender, only in a separate jug. This will form part of the icing (frosting) mixture. Preheat the oven to Gas Mark 3, 325ºF or 162ºC.  Mix together the flour, sugar, baking powder and butter. Combine well until the mixture becomes smooth and all ingredients are smooth. Strain the lavender infused milk (for the cupcake) and throw away the flower buds. Pour into the flour mixture along with the egg and beat until well combined. Spoon the mixture evenly into the paper cases (cupcake liners) until each case is two-thirds full. Place into the oven and bake for 20-25 minutes roughly. They are ready when a knife inserted in the centre of a cupcake comes out clean. Allow to cool on a wire cooling tack after removing from the oven using oven mitts. Making the icing (frosting) Beat together the icing sugar and butter until there are no lumps. You can add a few drops of purple food colouring into the frosting mixture to make it seem more like lavender. Strain the lavender infused milk, throw away the leaves and add this to the icing mixture. Beat until the mixture is light and fluffy. Spoon the icing (frosting) on top of the cupcakes when cooled. Leave to set before serving. For a nice finishing touch, add a sprig of dried lavender on top of the lavender cakes. Finished.
